title: RS21948
content: The 9/11 Commission made a number of recommendations to improve the quality ofintelligenceanalysis. A key recommendation was the establishment of a Director of National Intelligence (DNI) position tomanage the national intelligenceeffort and serve as the principal intelligence adviser to the President -- along with a separate director of the CentralIntelligence Agency. Subsequently, the Intelligence Reform and Terrorism Prevention Act of 2004, P.L. 108-458, made the DNI theprincipal adviser to the President onintelligence and made the DNI responsible for coordinating community-wide intelligence estimates. Some observersnote that separating the DNIfrom the analytical offices may complicate the overall analytical effort. This report will be updated as newinformation becomes available.
